feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 2:57PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snowfall Expected for the Eastern Interior Tonight and Monday... A mix of rain and snow is expected to develop this evening southeast of Livengood, then change to all snow late tonight before tapering off on Tuesday. Fairbanks is expected to get less than an inch of wet snow by Monday night, but areas south and east of town will see 1 to 3 inches of wet snow. Areas in the eastern Alaska Range

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 01 at 2:51PM AKDT until October 03 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 01 at 2:51PM AKDT until October 03 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 2:24PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and blowing snow in the Brooks Range into Monday... An arctic front moving through the Brooks Range will bring snow and blowing snow. 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected tonight into Monday, along with northerly winds 15 to 30 mph which will reduce visibility. Use caution if traveling in the area.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 29 at 12:54PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... The South Coast AQMD has issued an air quality alert due to increased particulate matter from blowing dust. The air quality alert is in effect from 1 PM Friday to 6 AM Monday. In areas directly impacted by high levels of windblown dust, limit

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 01 at 9:31PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .Heavy rainfall that has fallen over or upstream from Astor, combined with elevated northeast winds and high astronomical tides, have brought the Saint Johns River at Astor to Moderate Flood Stage. River levels are forecast to remain just above Moderate Flood Stage

entry.summary: ....Areas of Dense Valley Fog Early This Morning... clear skies and light winds has prompted the development of river valley fog early this morning. In New York, Southern Westchester County. * WHEN...From noon through 4 PM EDT Monday.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 01 at 1:55PM PDT until October 02 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Increased threat of sneaker waves expected. * WHERE...The beaches of Curry, Coos and Douglas Counties. * WHEN...From 11 AM PDT Monday morning through 8 PM PDT Monday evening.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued October 01 at 10:35PM CDT until October 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Red Flag Warning for portions of Southeast Texas, Central and Southern Louisiana again Monday... .Relative humidity values between 25 and 35 percent with highs in the mid to upper 90s can be expected again on Monday. Meanwhile, fuels in this area are extremely dry due to the ongoing exceptional drought. This combined with sustained 20 foot winds
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Northern Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton; Southern Orange

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 01 at 8:59AM MDT until October 03 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT Monday night.

entry.summary: ...Areas of fog this morning... Fog has developed in the mountain valleys and along area rivers and lakes this morning. The visibility in some locations was less than one-half mile.
